item.title: Report E-2024120249
item.description:
Report E-2024120249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 12, 2014, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Wheel Acid was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all released product from the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. The impacted pallet was dismantled and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum,

Inner contents: 5 metal cans labeled: LEAKED: Aceite E.M. DE Pink Grapefruit PAMPL0001, CAS 8016-20-4, CMDE/PO 2400071833, Tariff 33011920, Y.Ref 34154/1, UN 1B1/X1.2/250/24/F/BVT202179 Aceite E. Frank-Incense, Y.Cd:01-3010012, CAS 8016-36-2, Cmde:2400071831, Tariff:33012949, Y.Ref:34154/1, UN1B1/X1.4/400/24/F/BVT202129/TOU Aceite E Menta (MENTH0002), Y.Cd: 01-3010078, N CAS: 8006-90-4, Cmde/PO:2400071832, Tariff:33012510,Y.Ref:34154/1, UN 1B1/X1.4/400/24/F BVT 202178/TOU A.E. CLOVE(Eugenia Caryophyllata), GIROF0007, N CAS:8000-34-8,Cmde:2400087001, Tariff:33012911, Y.Cd:01-3010099, UN 1B1/X10/S/24/F BVT 202113/TOU All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024120232
item.description:
Report E-2024120232

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: FARRAGUT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 7, 2024, at 1751 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Farragut, TN regarding the release of BPW 76910 Antifoam. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 0.5 gallons of BPW 76910 Antifoam (UN3082, 9, III) from (1) 330-gallon poly tote onto the trailer floor and asphalt parking lot. The release was reportedly due to a crack in the tote, impacting a 4’ x 6’ area on the trailer and a 1’ x 3’ area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors transferred the remaining product into a new 330-gallon poly tote to continue on with the client’s shipment and took the damaged tote off-site for proper disposal. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, which was then taken off site by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 27th two drums were damaged by a forklift during the PM sort. The drums contained UN1263, PAINT, 3, II. The drums were fully emptied due to the damage, the other 27 drums were not damaged. The two damaged drums were placed into salvage drumsand sent off for disposal. The shipper was contacted for an amended shippers dec for the remaining drums.

item.title: Report X-2024120509
item.description:
Report X-2024120509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained twelve glass bottles in two plastic bags. The plastic bags contained absorbent material with the bottles and styrofoam packing peanuts for dunnage. One bottle in each bag was broken spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024120126
item.description:
Report E-2024120126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: GREENEVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 6, 2024, Roadrunner Transportation Systems reported one 55-gallon metal drum of Zirconium Octoate (UN1993, 3, III) was damaged, resulting in the release of approximately 10 gallons of product. The release was contained to a 10 x 6 area of the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched and cleaned up the release with absorbents, and simple green. The damaged drum was overpacked and forwarded on to the consignee. All was generated was containerized in (3) 55-gallon metal drums which were taken offsite pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110380
item.description:
Report E-2024110380

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/11/2024, at 0709 hours, personnel in the CSXT Wauhatchie Yard in Chattanooga, Tennessee, discovered PROX32359, a tank car, residue: last contained, Butane leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Centennial Energy was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-11-11-00010). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found an active leak from the protective housing. Upon further inspection it was found to have the B-end liquid valve partially open; and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight with no thread tape applied. The vapor valve was also found to be partially open with the secondary closure plug less than tool tight without thread tape. Contractor personnel we able to close both valves, apply thread tape to the secondary plugs and secure them with a wrench. The issues identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Nick Petrosky (303-370-7102, npetrosky@centennialenergy.us).
